page.title: 02Houses in the Norton region.
page.content: The oldest houses in the area are built out of the local stone, much of which was quarried from Brown Edge.Brown Edge village itself has many fine stone buildings. A number of stone farmhouses date from the seventeenth century, or if you listen to their owners much earlier. Brick buildings of the eighteenth and early nineteenth century can be seen in Norton village showing where the early settlement started. By the later nineteenth century terraced houses were being built for the miners working in the local mines. Rows of these can be seen in Ball Green.By the beginning of the twentieth century large numbers of terraced houses were being built in Stockton Brook, Milton and Ball Green.In the inter war period the Ball Green estate of brick semis was erected and this was followed by the Norton estate which is post war.
